Articles.Content:
Hello intelligent humans! 

I recently downloaded KSP from Steam. I was very excited to start shooting for the stars until I realised that the game had no audio whatsoever. I've tried multiple 

solutions including uninstalling and reinstalling the game, updating audio drivers, trying different speakers etc. (and yes I did make sure all the audio was turned on 

in the game's settings)

 

I am running Winows 10 64-bit on a custom PC.

GPU: Radeon RX570

CPU: Ryzen 7 2700X

MOBO: MSI B350 Tomahawk

RAM: 16GB (2x8GB) 2400mHz

 

Can someone please help. KSP is one of my fav games on this planet. (BTW who's excited for KSP 2 being released?)

Thanks

16 hours ago, TheQubit said:

I recently downloaded KSP from Steam. I was very excited to start shooting for the stars until I realised that the game had no audio whatsoever. I've tried multiple 

solutions including uninstalling and reinstalling the game, updating audio drivers, trying different speakers etc. (and yes I did make sure all the audio was turned on 

in the game's settings)

 

Are you using Realtek Drivers?

They are usually the best but you have to figure out how to remove the confilicting drivers that come with Windows and Graphic card etc.

Some posts and solutions i found with google:

https://steamcommunity.com/app/220200/discussions/0/144512753469545702/

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/180786-no-sound-on-new-steam-ksp-install/

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/177768-no-sound/

 

Edited August 26, 2019 by Boyster
